-1.title: Episode dated 6 March 2016
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Southern Sweets
1.plot: Damaris Phillips shows a young father-to-be how to make a sweet meal, which includes chili over chai grits; sorghum candy apple; burnt orange marshmallow cupcakes.

2.title: Ultimate Down-Home Breakfast
2.plot: A man prepares breakfast in bed for his fiancée with help from Damaris, who takes advantage of the fall harvest to make pumpkin scones with maple-cinnamon icing, a homemade granola parfait and a baked quiche with country ham.

3.title: Game Day!
3.plot: A guy who's dating someone who likes a rival sports team prepares a potluck to help smooth things over during the game. The menu features pot-roast sandwiches, chow-chow, beer, cheese and mac.

4.title: Southern Comforts
4.plot: Fall in Kentucky means an abundance of root vegetables which inspires Damaris to design a menu brimming with bright, comforting flavors. It's a perfect menu to help lovelorn Will make vegetables alluring for his wife.

5.title: Taste of Home
5.plot: Damaris designs a seasonal menu, featuring the sweet & savory flavors of poultry w/figs, to remind a soldier's wife of when they first fell in love. Recipes include turkey meatloaf with fig catsup; miso greens; goat cheese smashed potatoes.

6.title: Touch of Bourbon
6.plot: A Kentucky spirit is a key ingredient in a holiday dinner prepared by a husband for his wife. Recipes include roasted chicken with pear butter and bourbon glaze; cauliflower curry with brown rice casserole; and a bourbon-pecan cake.

1.title: Movie Snacking
1.plot: Damaris makes movie snacks with help from a pastry chef. On the menu: hickory-and-Gorgonzola popcorn; wild mushroom-and-cheddar pork sausages; homemade candy bars with chunks of cookies and caramel.

2.title: Southern Italian
2.plot: Damaris shops for ingredients at her favorite neighborhood Italian grocery store and transforms them into a decadent but easy goat-cheese gnocchi with bacon, dates and a Kentucky brown-butter wine sauce. For dessert, she makes a silky buttermilk panna cotta.

3.title: Pizza Party
3.plot: A visit from Damaris' niece and her friends prompts the chef to make kid-friendly food - foods that kids love with sneaky tricks to get them to eat well. With easy clean-up strategies, simple, sure-fire recipes and a little bit of chef's magic, Damaris shows how to make special meals for the little loved ones in your family. Meals include waffles made with semolina and sun-dried tomatoes and served with homemade pizza sauce; a cast-iron recipe for chocolate chip cherry cookies.

4.title: Big Southern Salad
4.plot: Damaris reveals one of her secrets to being a great restaurant chef: use interesting and unexpected spices. To show why spices matter, she takes on a typically boring dish - the salad - and transforms it into a whole meal with bold flavors and interesting textures. Highlighting easy techniques to roast vegetables, devil eggs and spice nuts, Damaris also demonstrates how to make fresh vinaigrette at home. And for an exotic complement, her savory za'atar biscuit takes Southern biscuit-making to a new level.

5.title: Family Feast
5.plot: Damaris helps her kitchen-challenged uncle prepare a spring lamb feast for the Phillips family. Included: an easy roasting method; and a mint chimichurri recipe. Also: feta-roasted new potatoes; and togarashi-glazed carrots.

6.title: When the Flavors Come Marching In
6.plot: Tasso ham from New Orleans inspires Damaris to prepare the traditional Louisiana dish, maque choux; a muffaletta sandwich with olive tapenade; and banana Foster bread.

7.title: Derby Party
7.plot: Damaris prepares a menu for a Kentucky Derby party. Included: hot browns with pimento-cheese mornay; mint julep; and chocolate-bourbon-pecan pie.

8.title: Taco Tuesday
8.plot: Mexican food is on the menu, including a "fauxrizo" taco filling that's spicy and easy to prepare; black beans flavored with coconut and lime; slaw made with creme fraiche, jicama and cilantro; and blackberry-and-sage margaritas.

9.title: Ladies' Tea Party
9.plot: Damaris creates an elegant menu for an afternoon tea party. On the menu: Benedictine, borage and bacon come together for a new twist on the cucumber sandwich. Also: a beet-and-potato salad w/blue-cheese dressing and dill; & saffron flower madeleines.

10.title: Dinner for Two
10.plot: Damaris helps a friend plan a low-stress romantic dinner for two. On the menu: pan-grilled shrimp with sumac sauce; fresh turmeric rice; and crispy sautéed zucchini.

11.title: Strong Is the New Skinny
11.plot: Damaris prepares a light, flavorful meal to enjoy after her workout. On the menu: quinoa-and-salmon croquettes; spaghetti squash with parsley-and-pecan pesto; strawberries with honey-rosemary whipped cream.

12.title: Grill and Chill
12.plot: Damaris puts jalapeño poppers and strawberries on the grill and then uses them in dishes that include pan-seared pork chops, cornbread and barbecue baked beans.

13.title: 30 Dollar Date
13.plot: Damaris plans a romantic picnic as part of a $30 date. On the menu: fried chicken-salad sandwiches and chocolate Mason jars. Plus, she makes a salad dressed with an Asian vinaigrette.

1.title: Late Night Feast
1.plot: In the Season 3 premiere, Damaris hosts a late-night feast, inspired by a zombie walk in Louisville. Her menu includes red-wine spaghetti with meatballs, plus banana pudding, and mulled wine.

2.title: Tailgate at the Big Game
2.plot: Food for a football tailgate is prepared, including pulled-pork nachos served with a mixture of avocado and sour cream; and for dessert, there's chewy barbecue brownies.

3.title: Picnic Day at the Races
3.plot: Damaris puts her own spin on traditional Southern picnic fare with her bourbon-brined fried chicken, braised red cabbage, and wine-infused mac and cheese.

4.title: Friends-Giving Leftovers
4.plot: Damaris hosts a stress-free dinner party, in honor of "Friends-Giving". Her strictly casserole menu features turkey and stuffing; green beans and smashed potato; and sweet-potato crumble.

5.title: Light on Your Feet
5.plot: A light and easy weeknight dinner is prepared. The menu includes a salad of fried olives and lentils; acorn squash stuffed with sausage; barley and goat cheese. Also: Damaris makes "dance the night away" energy bars.

6.title: Cocktail Party Bites
6.plot: Damaris throws a joint birthday-karaoke party, featuring easy appetizers. Included: fish-taco bites; cheesecake lollipops; butter-bean hummus; and for cocktails, a pink-ginger fizz.

7.title: Gift Basket of Food
7.plot: Damaris prepares food-filled gift baskets to give out during the holidays. Recipes include homemade bourbon-vanilla extract as the base for spoon fudge; prime rib burgers with steak sauce; Caesar salad with kale and cornbread croûtons.

8.title: Card Game with Grampy
8.plot: Creamy tomato soup and grilled pimento-cheese sandwiches are on the menu, when Damaris and her boyfriend receive a bridge lesson from her 99-year-old gramps. Also: pineapple upside-down cake.

9.title: Episode #3.9
9.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Rainy Day Egg Hunt
1.plot: In the season 4 premiere, a rainy day egg hunt features a menu of country ham and scalloped potatoes with an iceberg wedge salad. Also: Damaris serves chocolate bunnies to the children and coconut-bourbon chocolates to the adults.

2.title: Elevated Comfort Dinner
2.plot: Damaris celebrates her fiancé's birthday with a special dinner. On the menu: spinach-and-artichoke pasta; a Caesar salad made with kale; chocolate-and-espresso layer cake with peanut butter icing.

4.title: Treat Yourself Supper
4.plot: Damaris hosts an at-home Southern spa day, that begins with an indulgent meal consisting of barbecue-glazed shrimp, baked grits and collards. Also: rhubarb-strawberry shortcake for dessert.

5.title: Fancy Fun Finger Foods
5.plot: Damaris prepares fork-free party snacks for a day of bridesmaid-dress shopping. On the menu: watermelon-and-feta skewers; baked fingerlings with sour-cream butter topped with catfish caviar; and champagne-berry chiffon.

6.title: Bourbon, Bacon, Boots Up!
6.plot: Damaris prepares a Kentucky-inspired meal, before a day of sightseeing with her friend. Included: BLTs topped with a bourbon-tomato aioli; a salad of stewed tomato and fresh mozzarella; grilled peach and bourbon crisp.

7.title: Spicy Feast in the Bluegrass
7.plot: Damaris takes inspiration from a trip to Mexico when she prepares roasted pumpkin seed-seared lima beans and a dish she's calling "enchalasagna". Also: a coconut-tequila-lime pie for dessert.

8.title: Freezer Pleasers for Mom
8.plot: Damaris cooks for her hard-working mom friends. On the menu: loaded skillet cornbread; Creole pinto beans; lavender-coconut macaroons.

9.title: Southern Fried Friendship
9.plot: Damaris and her chef friend have a dinner party. On the menu: spicy hot chicken fried steak sandwiches; smoked macaroni salad; and blackberry-almond cobbler.

10.title: Pecan-Encrusted with Love
10.plot: Damaris makes lunch for two of her aunts. On the menu: peanut-crusted stuffed chicken; Southern risotto; and a savory bed of rice topped with caramelized asparagus.

11.title: Phillips Family Grilltacular
11.plot: Grilling potluck recipes for a family gathering are featured. On the menu: a spicy banana pepper jam, which is used on a pork tenderloin; succotash pasta salad; and an old-fashioned cocktail.

12.title: Grampy's Got a Sweet Tooth
12.plot: Damaris prepares a special sweet brunch for Father's Day. On the menu are cinnamon-roll biscuits with sweet-tea caramel, along with a five-cup ambrosia and easy breakfast sausage.

13.title: Pizza Jammin' All Night
13.plot: A fancy white party to celebrate summer features recipes made with pale ingredients. Included: a pizza topped with roasted chicken breast, homemade peach jam and Brie; and an orange blossom Bundt cake with white chocolate ganache.

25.title: PB&J Came to Play
25.plot: An outing with two children to a puppet theater includes a homemade lunch of crispy fried meatloaf sandwiches, topped with a sweet and tangy green-tomato jam. Also: carrot-raisin-salad rolls; and peanut-butter-and-jelly cookies.

1.title: Close to Home
1.plot: In the Season 5 premiere, Damaris plans a glamping staycation, as a surprise for her hardworking husband. She serves Southern Sloppy Joes and crunchy butternut squash slaw, plus s'more bites for dessert.

2.title: Picking and Picnicking
2.plot: Damaris and some friends go on a farm adventure, during which they make pickled peaches. But first, she prepares a picnic lunch, featuring zucchini-noodle salad and blackened chicken sandwiches with almond butter and red pepper jam.

3.title: Grandma's Cookbook
3.plot: Damaris is inspired to update a few of her grandmother's most memorable recipes, including porcupine meatballs in sauerkraut, buttery baked potato rolls and oatmeal-molasses cookies.

4.title: Carved and Sweetly Starved
4.plot: Damaris helps her sister prepare for Halloween by carving pumpkins, decorating the house and making sweet treats. On the menu: red velvet lava cake; cornmeal-and-white-chocolate biscotti; roasted chicken white chili.

5.title: Fairest of the Fair
5.plot: Damaris and a friend visits the Kentucky State Fair, on a mission to eat crazy and decadent foods. Later, the ladies create bite-size appetizers, inspired by their trip. Included: corn-dog muffins; pimento cheese jalapeño poppers; Meyer lemon shake-up tarts.

6.title: Arrow to My Heart
6.plot: Damaris joins her friend, who's passionate about historical reenactments, in an Old World archery contest. Inspired by the experience, she later prepares a salad of marinated beet and Stiton; sausage and savory herb quiche; butter pecan crumpets.

7.title: Turkey Two Ways and Sweet Potato Heaven
7.plot: Turkey is prepared two ways, when Damaris and her family get together for Thanksgiving. Included: chicken-fried turkey breast with cranberry-mustard dipping sauce; and smoked whole turkey. Also: a decadent side dish, twice-baked sweet potatoes with sea salt marshmallow caramels.

8.title: Dinner Under the Stars
8.plot: A dinner under the stars is planned to celebrate a friend's engagement. Make-ahead recipes include: creamy fall lasagna; shaved cauliflower salad with toasted pecans and cranberries; pear Bellinis.

9.title: Newlyweds Under the Mistletoe
9.plot: Damaris and her husband, Darrick Wood, share an intimate holiday meal. On the menu: porter-and-vegetable shepherd's pie; popper jack mashed potatoes; mulled wine-poached pears with toasted almonds.

10.title: Catch Me If You Can
10.plot: Damaris and a friend work up an appetite, while taking a circus aerial class. On the menu: sesame-tuna salad; miso-seared sweet potatoes; and sautéed apples with ginger-snap crumble.

11.title: Game Night
11.plot: Damaris hosts a game night. On the menu: Kentucky red beans and rice, topped with crispy country ham; mango-chutney green beans; and coconut crème brulee.

12.title: Halftime Ham Sandwich
12.plot: Damaris hosts a football-viewing party. On the menu: fresh-baked ham that's sliced thin, served on a sweet roll and topped with fried pickles and Cajun aioli. Also: homemade potato tots.

13.title: Home Alone
13.plot: Damaris spends a night home alone, indulging in her favorite foods. Her "me time" includes making roasted-vegetable-and-truffle mac and cheese; buffalo-chicken meatloaf; and a plum-and-sage mojito.

imdb.plot outline: True Southern cooking is an act of love. Chef Damaris Phillips continues to takes on the traditions of the South with easy, approachable recipes designed to help build confidence for new cooks. Southern at Heart captures her infectious spirit and celebrates the flavors of Kentucky , where local ingredients are turned into sure-fire crowd pleasers that will inspire anyone to elevate their cooking. Taking on food that's essential to Southern cuisine, Damaris' contemporary approach finds complex flavor combinations that come together in simple ways that always work. Southern at Heart takes a lighter approach to Southern food with delicious results.
imdb.title: Southern at Heart
plot: From preparing a special dish for a date to helping beginners master the perfect meal for their partner, Damaris plays matchmaker and chef to a tee in her six-episode series, providing entertainment and delicious food along the way.::Futon Critic

True Southern cooking is an act of love. Chef Damaris Phillips continues to takes on the traditions of the South with easy, approachable recipes designed to help build confidence for new cooks. _Southern at Heart_ (qv) captures her infectious spirit and celebrates the flavors of Kentucky , where local ingredients are turned into sure-fire crowd pleasers that will inspire anyone to elevate their cooking. Taking on food that's essential to Southern cuisine, Damaris' contemporary approach finds complex flavor combinations that come together in simple ways that always work. _Southern at Heart_ (qv) takes a lighter approach to Southern food with delicious results.::Anonymous
